qas.question: Who were the original settlers of the area that became the Marshall Islands?
How were original settlers of the area able to move between islands?
In what year did a European explorer first see the Marshall Islands?
Which explorer first saw the Marshall Islands?
For whom are the Marshall Islands named?
During what span were the Marshall Islands first settled?
In what decade did Europeans first visit the Marshall Islands?
In what month and year did a European first arrive at the Marshall Islands?
After whom are the Marshall Islands named?

context: <a0_0>Micronesian colonists<a0_0/> gradually settled the Marshall Islands during the <a5_0>2nd millennium BC<a5_0/>, with inter-island navigation made possible using <a1_0>traditional stick charts<a1_0/>. Islands in the archipelago were first explored by Europeans in the <a6_0>1520s<a6_0/>, with Spanish explorer <a3_0>Alonso de Salazar<a3_0/> sighting an atoll in <a7_0>August <a2_0>1526<a7_0/><a2_0/>. Other expeditions by Spanish and English ships followed. The islands derive their name from British explorer <a4_0><a8_0>John Marshall<a8_0/><a4_0/>, who visited in 1788. The islands were historically known by the inhabitants as "jolet jen Anij" (Gifts from God).
